instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont run off battery
threads.message:
Arrived with liquid damage but none near <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> or battery connector.

OSX recognizes and charges battery but wont run off the battery. <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR> is good

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on battery alone 3.8V

Changed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> no change.

Diode mode on <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_SDA</SIGNAL>/SCL lines is good

Using known good battery.

Should SMC be changed next??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont run off battery
threads.message:
I suppose you've meant <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> all the time.

"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on battery alone 3.8V"
Did you try known good battery?
If battery is really charged, there should be higher value?
Does the percentage increases, when charging?

Be sure <RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR> is good.
Check if J6950 is not half broken; saw this few times.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont run off battery
threads.message:
yes using known good battery and percentage is 100. 

<RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR> is good

J6950 is in perfect shape

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont run off battery
threads.message: What is battery voltage at the battery connector (without charger)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont run off battery
